description: After the application of the security updates related to CVE-2024-21431, users may experience impairments in system stability, particularly in environments utilizing Hypervisor-Protected Code Integrity (HVCI). This could manifest as unexpected behavior like system crashes, slow performance, or failure to enforce intended code integrity protections. The affected builds include Windows 10 versions 21H2 and 22H2, as well as Windows 11 versions 21H2, 22H2, and 23H2. Users should reference KB5035845, KB5035853, and KB5035854 for detailed guidance on the patches and the consequences of not applying them. Given that this issue impacts critical security features, the observable issues may indicate the need for immediate remediation to restore system integrity.
